physical_appearance:This copper engraving is a city plan map of Batavia. The title is engraved at the top of the map
 on a designed bannner. On the right of the banner is an emblem of a lion. The engraving shows a detailed layout of the city with extensive network of canals. The left of the map shows several ships and boats at the harbour of Batavia. On the right
 there is a detailed lettered legend identifying key sites. The scale is printed near the bottom
 above a scenic view of the harbour. There is a signature of the creator at the bottom of the map.
subject_terms_1:colonization colonial settlements historical maps harbours ships

subject_terms_3:Urban planning
sgcool_label_text:This copper engraving illustrates a detailed city plan of Batavia (Jakarta)
 the Dutch capital of the Dutch East Indies. The map was from Clemendt de Jonghe
 an important and well-known editor and seller of prints and maps in Amsterdam during the 1650s to 1670s.

metadata.physical_appearance: This copper engraving is a city plan map of Batavia. The title is engraved at the top of the map, on a designed bannner. On the right of the banner is an emblem of a lion. The engraving shows a detailed layout of the city with extensive network of canals. The left of the map shows several ships and boats at the harbour of Batavia. On the right, there is a detailed lettered legend identifying key sites. The scale is printed near the bottom, above a scenic view of the harbour. There is a signature of the creator at the bottom of the map.
metadata.subject_terms_1: colonization colonial settlements historical maps harbours ships
metadata.subject_terms_2: Maps Engraving Jakarta (Indonesia) Colonies Historical geography Maps ships harbors
metadata.sgcool_label_text: This copper engraving illustrates a detailed city plan of Batavia (Jakarta), the Dutch capital of the Dutch East Indies. The map was from Clemendt de Jonghe, an important and well-known editor and seller of prints and maps in Amsterdam during the 1650s to 1670s.
